metadata.title: CVE-2022-22761 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Web-accessible extension pages (pages with a moz-extension:// scheme) were not correctly enforcing the frame-ancestors directive when it was used in the Web Extension's Content Security Policy. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 97, Thunderbird < 91.6, and Firefox ESR < 91.6.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
